alert.note: Alert for Walsh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 10:02AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast North Dakota, including the following county, Walsh. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1002 AM CDT, emergency management reported ongoing flooding over a few state highways, county and township roads. Flooding is expected to expand as snowmelt continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grafton, Park River, Minto, Hoople, Fordville, Edinburg, Forest River, Adams, Pisek, Warsaw, Lankin, Oakwood, Ardoch, Veseleyville, Auburn, Fairdale, Nash, Voss, Conway and Mandt.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
